stories.title: A simple machine that points to the ISS (2019)
A search engine driven by wisdom

stories.text: Since the beginning of Web3's talk I started wondering whether it's possible to build a fully transparent and open source platform, one where not only we know what data is saved but also can see the data itself. Would there be a way of doing this without breaking all privacy's laws?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is it possible to build a fully open-source platform?

stories.text:
Mido Lotto ( https://midolotto.com/ ) buys lottery tickets (physically, in person) and then resells them to you online, via an app, for a premium. They don't physically give you the ticket, they keep custody of it and, if you win, they give you the prize.

We've had a long discussion in my house this morning about whether this can possibly be legal, and we're sure that it is not. Is it?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is “Mido Lotto” Legal?
